text: Linear city is a model in modern urban planning. It was first developed by the Spanish urban planner Arturo Soria y Mata in 1882. It was an alternative to densely populated industrial cities.Roger W. Caves, Encyclopedia of the City (Oxford; New York: Routledge, 2005), p. 291 The idea was resumed in the 20th century in East Germany and Soviet Union. == Related pages == * Grid plan * Sector model * Multiple nuclei model * Concentric zone model == References == == Other websites == * The Linear city website a Canadian site dedicated to the Linear city idea * Infrastructure corridor as linear city Category:Urban planning Category:Urban design
